text: Sir Albert Edward Patrick Duffy (born 17 June 1920) is a British economist and Labour Party politician. He was born in London and served in World War II. He was a Member of Parliament for Colne Valley from 1963 to 1966 and for Sheffield Attercliffe from 1970 to 1992. He was a Minister of the Navy in the 1970s, and President of the NATO Assembly in the 1980s. Duffy was a critic of Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher.Mrs. Thatcher says death of Sands won't alter London's Ulster policy(New York Times, 5 May 1981) ==References== Category:1920 births Category:Living people Category:British economists Category:British autobiographers Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs Category:British military personnel of World War II Category:UK MPs 1959–1964 Category:UK MPs 1964–1966 Category:UK MPs 1970–1974 Category:UK MPs 1974 Category:UK MPs 1974–1979 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:Politicians from London Category:Writers from London
title: Patrick Duffy (British politician)
